claims.object: transmitting sensory information from the skin, skeletal muscle, and sensory organs to the CNS

surface_layer.definition: Neurons responsible for transmitting sensory information.

deep_layer.mechanism: Sensory neurons have specialized receptors that detect stimuli and convert them into electrical signals.

SPATIAL.location: Throughout the peripheral nervous system, dorsal root ganglia, cranial nerve ganglia

epistemic_metadata.source: Nervous System and the Senses – Introduction to Living Systems
